meanings.definition: Resembling lead in color or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sky turned plumbeous as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: The old statue had a plumbeous hue due to years of weathering.
meanings.sent3: The plumbeous clouds seemed to weigh heavily on the horizon.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as plumbeous as the overcast sky.
meanings.sent5: The lake reflected a plumbeous sheen under the gray clouds.

meanings.sent1: The plumbeous paint on the door gave it a dull appearance.
meanings.sent2: His hands were stained plumbeous from working with lead pipes.
meanings.sent3: The plumbeous blanket felt heavy and cool against her skin.
meanings.sent4: The plumbeous taste of the water indicated high metal content.
meanings.sent5: The plumbeous armor protected the knight in battle.
